bow: mourning the end of breastfeeding my son is about month away from turning and we stopped nursing officially at the end of june am relieved that we weaned by the yr mark set as my goal and proud that we made it work for so long despite struggles his collar bone was broken during labor due to complications delivering so he refused to nurse from one side entirely and never accepted both boobs it was hell at first but we made it and it became our special bond and such cherished time together he looked forward to bedtime and needed me specifically and now that it finally gone for good not having more kids and dad can help with bedtime routine sad for it loss probably even more than am proud for our accomplishment in no way complaining or ungrateful that finally have some help and freedom but miss it despite the fact we still snuggle extra hard and still have special moments it just the nursing itself mourning right now no one else in my support circle can empathize much so hoped to get it off my chest here another major milestone come and gone *i not crying you re crying** right there with you weaning my 19 month old and even though so done with breastfeeding it has been pretty emotional for me too well done super mama still breastfeeding my lb of and even though desperate to stop being his comforter dreading when he ll actually stop we ve been on very slow wean since his birthday at the start of may usually only night feeding but still the occasional day feed do get lot of comments about how he does need it now did even plan on feeding this long but it was also bit of struggle to get started after had an emergency section and he lost lot of weight in the first few days from struggling to latch it ll be bittersweet sure but hoping by september when he really starts his half days at school he ll be done it so emotional is it with my first slowly dried up because of work pumping so was heartbroken each time with my youngest chose to wean and it was still really hard years op you re amazing my lo months weaned himself few weeks ago my boobs got so sore and it was really sad feeling to have milk for him that he didnt want miss the closeness we used to share already when you stop nursing there is huge drop in hormones post weaning depression is absolutely true and it hit me hard when weaned both of my kids if it lasts more than few weeks call your doctor take it easy on yourself and spend lots of time cuddling your little boy you ll feel so much better once your hormones regulate oh man we are down to nursing once in the am and am hesitant to cut that out because not sure if ready emotionally to win yet my son will be two in october so have mental going to make it at least month before his birthday to officially completely weaned him it going to be emotional for sure good job mama you made it so far my son is almost 12 now but do remember feeling sad when we stopped breastfeeding at they talk about never knowing when it your last time carrying your child up the stairs or last snuggle in bed before sleep etc but when we decide it time to end breastfeeding you know it over definitely little grief around that after nursing him to sleep for nearly two years how has the transition gone now that you re not does he still go down easy congrats on almost two years of nursing mama feel ya our goal was year had ppa over my supply the entire time so thought would miss it but on our final feed cried she started teething terribly week later so tried to bring it back even though knew there was much left in there it was the same she got upset there was much there so we really are done understand have three kids and logged total of 60 months of breastfeeding between them when get sad about the eras of childhood that we are leaving think about how many fun milestones are coming our way there is so much to look forward to and having big kids imo is hell of lot more fun than having babies toddlers mine are 14 12 and now and they are fantastic we are at just past but we ve been skipping days and 14 weeks with number and it looks like my supply is done it definitely special bond and ll miss it too congrats every new milestone is bittersweet my daughter and quit nursing about week ago and she just turned as well it really hard that years of such special one on one time that we don really have anymore understand how you re feeling and have been mourning it myself the ability for dad to be more involved in the bedtime routine is great but it is kind of sad too it such weird mix of emotions guess don have any words of wisdom or even comfort but stand with you and completely understand what you re going through❤️ my daughter just turned two and is currently drinking an old cold bottle of stored milk she specifically asked for today was the first time she didn nurse waking up in the morning she did nurse after her nap but that feed has become optional lately whereas the morning one was the one routine feed she also did her first unprompted poo in the potty today with nothing going wrong or ending up in other places than it should they re growing up so fast becoming more and more independent as they should my daughter is hopefully not our only and last child but she could be funnily enough my husband seems to mourn the nearing end of our breastfeeding journey more than do he loves seeing us snuggle and he misses the days she was an infant instead of will full toddler would love to be able to wear whatever want again and have my body back to myself but the closeness of breastfeeding is amazing big hugs for you and your developing child you made it to your goal and gave them lot well done letting go is hard this is one of the first signs of independence they need to grow independent preparing them for it is basically our job as parents rock it the same thing happened to my family friend with the collarbone ♥️ so hard ve shared this here before but it been while so sorry if you ve already seen it here poem wrote about weaning https jessicabateswriter com first latch podcast such an emotional time sending hugs would love to know this as well we reached year today and we co sleep but am very ready to be done with that part and maybe just nurse him in the morning before work until he does want to anymore just do know how the nighttime transition will go op is amazing for going years my son is months and so over bf and pumping he has finally started accepting formula from bottle ve decided that ll bf before bed and in the middle of the night if he wakes up but that it so happy to be little bit liberated but also sad feel you not sure how ll handle it when he or decide to stop it completely really appreciate you writing this not op but had heard of post weaning depression before and it making lot of things make more sense thank you for bringing it up was planning on weaning at years but my son decided he was done couple weeks ago just before his 18 month birthday while am glad it was his decision was really dreading weaning because of how much he loved to nurse it still broke my heart little bit on the flip side he way more cuddly now and since he no longer nursing find myself enjoying it more congratulations on making it so long with such tough challenges hope the sadness passes quickly for you ❤️ can relate weaned my youngest couple of months ago for me it was the end of eight consecutive years of nursing my oldest nursed for three years my middle child for two and my youngest for three your hormones haven yet balanced out had been very sensitive to the hormonal changes it completely normal to feel sense of mourning it bittersweet milestone if your grief ever feels unmanageable talk to your doctor cried so much after my first weaned and felt so much outside pressure to just be relieved yes it was bit exciting to have certain kind of freedom back but the thought that would never again nurse her to sleep was so so sad allow yourself to grieve that special slice of time you had with your child it is magical one wow yeah same here thanks for posting this bc had no idea it was thing my daughter is fighting hard to keep nursing but my supply is slowly just fading away and starting to feel really weird and depressed good to know this is thing not sure if should try to just fully stop or what kinda didn plan on weaning before she was and kinda bummed about it made the decision to stop night nursing at year and my son decided the next morning that he wasn going to nurse at all anymore was prepared to end the night nursing but stopping all nursing was complete surprise and was more than little sad it is so wonderful that you met your goal and got through the hurdles my milk stopped producing at six months partly because did respond well to having to use pump and was broken hearted it good to hear that you achieved your goal oh totally with you one day offered up nursing to my daughter she took one suck and was done with it and that was the end see why people have second kid now lol my son is and he dropping the night nursing all by himself he ll latch few suckles then flip himself over to just dig his chin in my arm and go to sleep yes thanks for saying this because it not common knowledge was aware and thankfully already on bf safe antidepressant for really bad ppd so the brunt of it was already being treated sure have struggled so much harder if done it before or after starting my medication most definitely was working toward being done entirely but was dragging my feet pretty hard and was sure when how was actually going to be done with bedtime feeds then he overate two nights in row and threw up all over us and the bed and we decided to be done with food drink right before bed after that second night so even though was nearing that realm of coming to terms with being done was ready for nor expecting that night to be the last one bawled so hard the first two nights after when dad put him to bed that was the part was most anxious about he used to fall right asleep when nursing and did know how it go without dad actually took over the first nights after we cut bedtime feeds they started new routine of watching movie for 10 mins before bed and then snuggling to sleep he was really resentful of me for the first week too he refused to even lay down in bed next to me without lot of coaxing but the new routine became more normal and it takes him longer to fall asleep now but he does ask for or expect the boob and put him to sleep on weekdays and dad does weekends best advice have is to start new bedtime routine and be patient and understanding of his feelings thank you so much and best of luck in your transition omg yes had to pump little to ease the discomfort until my supply diminished and every time had to waste that milk made me cry have donated it but pretty rural and idk how even go about that here sigh hang in there mama we ll all get through it and find new opportunities for closeness sure there will always be some semblance of grief over the loss of it though really good point and the strategy ve tried to employ too he my first and last and am so much looking forward to everything growing up will bring so sad to lose my baby but ecstatic to gain my sweet child and eventually my young man lot of complicated emotions take care of yourself watch for depression and find special moments during the day for just you and your lo hang in there thank you so much eventually it became the easiest and most convenient way to feed him because did have to mess with work pumping as sahm lol it extra hard when you do have much choice in the matter at least was able to choose when we ended it so felt little more in control of the emotional situation ah man it can be really hard when the timeline changes on you was dragging my feet with bedtime feeds and honestly did expect to make it by and yes mine more cuddly now too and especially soon after he got over the fact that we were done he was really angry and resentful of me at first and would even lay in bed with me for the first week dad took over bedtime and he eventually got over it and the snuggles are precious ❤️ thank you so much was the same his birthday is in september and was planning to make it to at least mid august but he was having an issue drinking too fast and puking at the end there so we stopped suddenly and earlier than expected though just marginally but still bawled right after we stopped and still get down sometime thank you and best of luck in your transition find other special moments to replace the intimacy of nursing ❤️ great job in all you ve accomplished too ah so sorry to hear about your struggles my sister just had her first lo months ago and has terrible ppa over her supply too she debating weaning at mo but is sure if she ready to say goodbye to that possiblity to nurse one of the hardest parts for me was the first time went to go nurse to comfort him after he got hurt and realized could anymore best of luck in your journey and amazing job for enduring all of the challenges of ppa and tricky supply you re amazing felt terrible for him and it was pretty embarrassing to be lopsided when my supply ran out on the side he could eat from due to his injury lol only time ve been thankful for my small chest because it was relatively easy to hide the fact that one had milk and one did haha tried to pump to keep my supply until he healed but had ppd and could maintain the nursing and the pumping every single time sigh have not seen it and will definitely read when able to have good cry tonight haha thank you so much for your support sending hugs back totally get it got good amount of comments jokes as mine passed the year mark too it did completely influence my weaning as we cut back to only nighttime feeds regardless but it did give me anxiety as we approached his second birthday we re pretty rural and people are often quite open about their ignorant beliefs haha that great to know there all this guilt tripping about sleep training early to avoid dependence on nursing to sleep later but the reality is that when the time comes they ll adapt because they have to glad it went well for you think it coming to an end for us too he didn want to this morning or really last night nursed him before bed tonight and my heart hurt little watching his sleepy eyes flutter knowing he won want to do it forever comraderie helps too ❤️ best of luck to you mama pumping is the absolute worst chose weird lopsided boobs for years because could not stand pumping from the side he refused every single time he never accepted it even after his clavicle healed and the one side dried up yay me lol best part about being done bf is normal looking boobs again good luck with your journey weaning brings lot of mixed emotions for sure but soon it ll just be small sadness in the back of your heart that you only find if you look for it ❤️ that how we started the process too skipping days best of luck the rest of the way and congrats on your pregnancy whoo go lo on her potty milestone mine started pooping in the toilet at 18 mos but hes inconsistent about telling me and we still have accidents if do notice he got to go in time best of luck to all three of you as you bring the bf journey to close with her thanks so much for your support too ❤️ oh mama breastfeeding is already hard so sorry you guys had extra challenges you have done so great for your child weaning emotions are real take care of yourself you ll both get through and you ll still be as close as ever hugs xo oh my goodness you re milk goddess can only imagine how hard that must be to adjust to losing after years thankfully started medication for my ppd and that helped regulate my mood relatively well even with the hormone changes sure it be much more of rollercoaster without that support thanks so much for your kindness and best of luck to you in your mourning adjustment process too ❤️ had cried so hysterically in long time as did the first night my husband put my son to sleep for me was wreck even though new level of freedom just opened up to me but still miss my bedtime nursing snuggles and imagine ll always be able to find that sadness somewhere in the back of my heart when think of not having it ever again thank you for your support and empathy ❤️ pumping is terrible hated it so much but thankfully was able to be sahm and nurse pretty exclusively it was gift and sure it contributed to our ability to keep up so long sorry your choice in the process was taken from you by something outside your control that an even harder loss to cope with imagine what big girl haha my son was pretty attached so he resented me for it the first week was bit brokenhearted by that too but totally understood why he was mad at me that only made me feel worse for taking it from him of course but he adjusted well and snuggles mom hard to make up for it though think he still misses it in passing too as he ll occasionally ask for it and nicely move on when remind him we do do that anymore sigh ll forever cherish the informal phone pics had the foresight to take of him nursing before it was over ❤️ this makes me cry for us both on one hand excited for what big independent boy he becoming but dang that bittersweet too took some pics with my phone of him nursing as he grew up because adore that perfect little serene face he used to make so glad have those to look back on but they send me into fit of tears currently especially as we verge closer to his second birthday haha best of luck to you and make sure to be gentle with yourself as you grieve the end of an important era for you both ❤️ omg tell me about it totally felt the pressure to sleep train and get him out of cosleeping but ignored the advice mostly because had really bad ppd and just had zero energy to try different method to put him to sleep nursing was easy for us both and it worked also assumed as he got older he naturally increase in independence and be bit less dependent on it and that was true to an extent he still struggled to understand the change in routine at first and resented my taking it away but he adjusted and the new routine became the new norm your kindness mixing with my hormones making me cry haha thank you so much for your support and encouragement ❤️ it means more than can tell you aww motherhood is really an emotional rollercoaster everyday wish my girl was more cuddly and affectionate when ask her for kiss or hug she legit says no to me sometimes thought had 16 years to prepare for this kind of rejection lol do think it matters where you are you ll always get ignorant people ve had it in city my hometown and the current town live in honestly do know what people think breasts and nipples were intended for certainly not for being objectified for sexual gratification though one of the things love people telling about the start of my bf journey was that all the midwives had go at milking me haha my boobs have never seen that much action haha thanks sister it helps lot just knowing all the other mommas out there have been through it too almost never get kisses anymore either he far too busy for that he will snuggle in my lap through so count that as win oh my goodness what good story lol becoming mother leaves you with little care for modesty at least for while lol and right no kidding and there are so many people who preach breast is best but place all these arbitrary guidelines on how we should breastfeed for how long where we do it etc ca win no matter what you do totally agree so glad for supportive community for moms to empathize ❤️ pmsl and yet for while was still shy about feeding in public and always draw the curtains around the hospital bed due to the looks was getting from new mums and dad alike go figure lol it was until one day in the supermarket where my feeding cover slipped off that realised there was nothing to be anxious about was just feeding my child yes they like to tell you certain places feed up to age but as its not visible you still feel on your own when people around you stop feeding lucky have to bribe her for affection haha read an interesting article awhile back that suggested humans were evolutionarily designed to continue nursing until the baby teeth fell out around and we only stopped that practice due to less food scarcity and stigma was bit uncomfortable to do it in public as well especially because of how often my son popped off to look around and exposed everything haha but my stubborn refusal to hide usually led me to just do it if needed to though usually fed him at home honesty it was mostly my father in law who made me feel uncomfortable he and his friends would joke about kids being about to ask for it or do it themselves implying that was too old to nurse he also has bit of that creepy old man vibe that is really off putting to both my husband and me and do like to be overly exposed around him that the only time allowed myself to hide because of what other people thought haha but good on you for doing what is best for your kiddo whatever that looks like and no matter the judgement mean seriously how is it hurting them to continue nursing beyond when is specially acceptable it not and eventually their need desire for independence will naturally develop and they ll grow out of it wonder if they think they ll just nurse until they re 40 if allowed sure seem to think that about cosleeping haha the world is very interesting place for those little minds haha no time for that mom my father in law was so much the other way he is very supportive of me doing it but even when my son was newborn if he walked into the room as was feeding he yelp and cover his eyes and apologise then leave the room he always thought thinks of it as such private thing between parent and child bless him co sleeping surprisingly is something people around me have much less of an issue with my husband stepdad is that way totally respectful not creepy or sexualized in any way he great guy and ve gotten some flack about that but very minor too
